utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ooh! Look! Look! Look! Look, there's Joey's picture! This is so exciting!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You can always spot someone who's never seen one of his plays before. Notice, no fear, no sense of impending doom...

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: The exclamation point in the title scares me. Y'know, it's not just Freud, it's Freud!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, shhh, shh. Magic is about to happen.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: well, Eva, we've done some excellent work here, and I would have to say, your problem is quite clear.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: God. I feel violated.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Did anybody else feel they just wanted to peel the skin off their body, to have something else to do?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ross, ten o'clock.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Is it? Feels like two.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No, ten o'clock.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: There's a beautiful woman at eight, nine, ten o'clock!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh. Hel-lo!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: She's amazing! She makes the women that I dream about look like short, fat, bald men!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, go over to her! She's not with anyone.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh yeah, and what would my opening line be? 'Excuse me. Blarrglarrghh.'

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, c'mon. She's a person, you can do it!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh please, could she be more out of my league? Ross, back me up here.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: He could never get a woman like that in a million years.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Thank you, buddy.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, oh, but y'know, you always see these really beautiful women with these really nothing guys, you could be one of those guys.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You could do that!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Y'think?

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Yeah!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh God, I can't believe I'm even considering this... I'm very very aware of my tongue...

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: C'mon! C'mon!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Here goes.

utterance.speaker: Aurora
utterance.content: ...Yes?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hi.... um... okay, next word... would be... Chandler! Chandler is my name, and, uh......hi.

utterance.speaker: Aurora
utterance.content: Yes, you said that.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yes, yes I did, but what I didn't say was what I was about to say, what I wanted to say was, uh... would you like to go out with me sometime, thankyou, goodnight.

utterance.speaker: Aurora
utterance.content: Chandler?

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Hey! You're in a play! I didn't know you could dance! You had a beard!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Whadja think?

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: ...Hey! You're in a play! I didn't know you could dance! You had a beard!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: C'mon, you guys, it wasn't that bad. It was better than that thing I did with the trolls, at least you got to see my head.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Saw your head. Saw your head.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: She said yes!! She said yes!! Awful play, man. Whoah. Her name's Aurora, and she's Italian, and she pronounces my name 'Chand-lrr'. 'Chand-lrr'. I think I like it better that way. Oh, listen, the usher gave me this to give to you.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What is it?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: The Estelle Leonard Talent Agency. Wow, an agency left me its card! Maybe they wanna sign me!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Based on this play? ...Based on this play!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey, kids.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No, 'cause this line is passion, and this is... just a line.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, I can't believe I've been here almost seven seconds and you haven't asked me how my date went.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, right, right. How was your date, 'Chand-lrr'?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: It was unbelievable. I-I've never met anyone like her. She's had the most amazing life! She was in the Israeli army...

utterance.speaker: Aurora
utterance.content: ...Luckily none of the bullets hit the engine block. So, we made it to the border, but just barely, and I- ...I've been talking about myself all night long, I'm sorry. What about you? Tell me one of your stories.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Alright. Once I got on the subway, right, and it was at night, and I rode it all the way to Brooklyn... just for the hell of it.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: We talked 'til like two. It was this perfect evening... more or less.

utterance.speaker: Aurora
utterance.content: ...All of a sudden we realised we were in Yammon.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, I'm sorry, so 'we' is?

utterance.speaker: Aurora
utterance.content: 'We' would be me and Rick.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Who's Rick?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Who's Rick?

utterance.speaker: Aurora
utterance.content: My husband.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Ooooohhh.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, so you're divorced?

utterance.speaker: Aurora
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, I'm sorry, then you're widowed?...Hopefully?

utterance.speaker: Aurora
utterance.content: No, I'm still married.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: So tell me, how do- how do you think your husband would feel about you sitting here with me?...Sliding your foot so far up my pant leg you can count the change in my pocket?

utterance.speaker: Aurora
utterance.content: Don't worry. I imagine he'd be okay with you because really, he's okay with Ethan.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ethan? There's, there's an Ethan?

utterance.speaker: Aurora
utterance.content: Mmmm... Ethan is my... boyfriend.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: So explain something to me here, uh, what kind of a relationship do you imagine us having if you already have a husband and a boyfriend?

utterance.speaker: Aurora
utterance.content: I suppose mainly sexual.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh. I'm sorry it didn't work out.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What 'not work out'? I'm seeing her again on Thursday. Didn't you listen to the story?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Didn't you listen to the story? I mean, this is twisted! How could you get involved with a woman like this?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, y'know, I had some trouble with it at first too, but the way I look at it is, I get all the good stuff: all the fun, all the talking, all the sex; and none of the responsibility. I mean, this is every guy's fantasy!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, yeah. That is not true. Ross, is this your fantasy?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No, of course not! ...Yeah, yeah, it is.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What? So you guys don't mind going out with someone else who's going out with someone else?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I couldn't do it.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Good for you, Joey.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: When I'm with a woman, I need to know that I'm going out with more people than she is.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, y'know, monogamy can be a, uh, tricky concept. I mean, anthropologically speaking-

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Fine. Fine, alright, now you'll never know.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: We're kidding. C'mon, tell us!

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Yeah! C'mon!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Alright. There's a theory, put forth by Richard Leakey-

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Tah-daaah!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Are we greeting each other this way now? 'Cause I like that.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Look! I cleaned! I did the windows, I did the floors... I even used all the attachments on the vacuum, except that little round one with the bristles, I don't know what that's for.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh yeah, nobody knows. And we're not supposed to ask.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, whaddya think?

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Very clean! It looks great! Terrific!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: ...Oh! I-I see you moved the green ottoman.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Uh-oh...

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: How-how did that happen?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I dunno.. I-I thought it looked better there. And I- and also, it's an extra seat around the coffee table.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah, it's interesting.. but y'know what? Just for fun, let's see what it looked like in the old spot. Alright, just to compare. Let's see. Well, it looks good there too. Let's just leave it there for a while.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I can't believe you tried to move the green ottoman.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Thank God you didn't try to fan out the magazines. I mean, she'll scratch your eyes right out.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You guys, I am not that bad!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, you are, Monica. Remember when I lived with you? You were like, a little, y'know, Ree! Ree! Ree! Ree!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: That is so unfair!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh c'mon! When we were kids, yours was the only Raggedy Ann doll that wasn't raggedy!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, so I'm responsible, I'm organised. But hey, I can be a kook.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Alright, you madcap gal. Try to imagine this. The phone bill arrives, but you don't pay it right away.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Because you're a kook! Instead you wait until they send you a notice.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I could do that.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay, uh, you let me go grocery shopping, and I buy laundry detergent, but it's not the one with the easy-pour spout.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Why would someone do that?! ...One might wonder.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Someone's left a glass on the coffee table. There's no coaster. It's a cold drink, it's a hot day. Little beads of condensation are inching their way closer and closer to the surface of the wood...

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: STOP IT!! ...Oh my God. It's true! Who am I?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Monica? You're Mom.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ree! Ree! Ree! Ree! Ree!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Uh huh.. uh huh... oh my God! Okay! Okay, I'll be there! That was my agent. My agent has just gotten me a job...in the new Al Pacino movie!

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Oh my God! Whoah!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, what's the part?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Can you believe this? Al Pacino! This guy's the reason I became an actor! "I'm out of order? Pfeeeh. You're out of order! This whole courtroom's out of order!"

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Seriously, what-what's the part?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: "Just when I thought I was out, they pull me back in!"

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: C'mon, seriously, Joey, what's the part?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: ...I'm his

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: ..You're, you're 'mah mah mah' what?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: ...I'm his butt double. 'Kay? I play Al Pacino's butt. Alright? He goes into the shower, and then- I'm his butt.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh my God.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: C'mon, you guys. This is a real movie, and Al Pacino's in it, and that's big!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh no, it's terrific, it's... it's... y'know, you deserve this, after all your years of struggling, you've finally been able to crack your way into show business.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay, okay, fine! Make jokes, I don't care! This is a big break for me!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You're right, you're right, it is...So you gonna invite us all to the big opening?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Alright, alright, alright...

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Here. I need to borrow some moisturizer.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: For what?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What do you think? Today's the big day!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh my God. Okay, go into the bathroom, use whatever you want, just don't ever tell me what you did in there.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Thank you!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Where's Joey? His mom's on the phone.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: He's in the bathroom. I don't think you wanna go in there!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: C'mon, we're roommates! My eyes!! My eyes!!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I warned you...

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Who is being loud?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, that would be Monica. Hey, listen, I wanna borrow a coupla things, Aurora spent the night, I really wanna make her breakfast.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, you got the whole night, huh?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, well, I only have twenty minutes until Ethan, so, y'know..

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ooh, do I sense a little bit of resentment?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No, no resentment, believe me, it's worth it. 'Kay? Y'know in a relationship you have these key moments that you know you'll remember for the rest of your life? Well, every- single- second is like that with Aurora.. and I've just wasted about thirty-five of them talking to you people, so, uh.. Monica, can you help me with the door?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Sure. Oh, um, Chandler? Y'know, the-the old Monica would-would remind you to scrub that Teflon pan with a plastic brush...But I'm not gonna do that.

utterance.speaker: Director
utterance.content: ...Dammit, hire the girl! Okay, everybody ready?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Uh, listen, I just wanna thank you for this great opportunity.

utterance.speaker: Director
utterance.content: Lose the robe.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Me?

utterance.speaker: Director
utterance.content: That would work.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Right. Okay. Losing the robe. And the robe is lost.

utterance.speaker: Director
utterance.content: Okay, everybody, we'd like to get this in one take, please. Let's roll it.. water's working .. and... action.

utterance.speaker: Director
utterance.content: And cut. Hey, Butt Guy, what the hell are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well, I'm- I'm showering.

utterance.speaker: Director
utterance.content: No, that was clenching.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh. Well, the way I see it, the guy's upset here, y'know? I mean, his wife's dead, his brother's missing... I think his butt would be angry here.

utterance.speaker: Director
utterance.content: I think his butt would like to get this shot before lunch. Once again, rolling... water working... and action....and cut. What was that?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I was going for quiet desperation. But if you have to ask...

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: God, I love these fingers...

utterance.speaker: Aurora
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No, actually I meant my fingers. Look at 'em, look at how happy they are.

utterance.speaker: Aurora
utterance.content: Oh my God, I'm late.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh no nonononononnononono, don't go..

utterance.speaker: Aurora
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Don't go.

utterance.speaker: Aurora
utterance.content: Okay. Oh no, I have to.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Too bad, she's leaving.

utterance.speaker: Aurora
utterance.content: I'm sorry. He'll be waiting for me.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, I thought- I thought you talked to Rick.

utterance.speaker: Aurora
utterance.content: It's not Rick.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What, Ethan? He got to spend the whole day with you!

utterance.speaker: Aurora
utterance.content: No, it's-it's Andrew.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I know there'll be many moments in the years to come when I'll regret asking the following question, but- And Andrew is?

utterance.speaker: Aurora
utterance.content: He's... new.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, so what you're saying is you're not completely fulfilled by Rick, Ethan and myself?

utterance.speaker: Aurora
utterance.content: No, that's not exactly what I was..

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, y'know, most women would kill for three guys like us.

utterance.speaker: Aurora
utterance.content: So what do you want?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You.

utterance.speaker: Aurora
utterance.content: You have me!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Nono, just you.

utterance.speaker: Aurora
utterance.content: Whaddyou mean?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Lose the other guys.

utterance.speaker: Aurora
utterance.content: ...Like, ...all of them?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: C'mon, we're great together, why not?

utterance.speaker: Aurora
utterance.content: Why can't we just have what we have now? Why can't we just talk, and laugh, and make love, without feeling obligated to one another... and up until tonight I thought that's what you wanted too.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: ...Well, y'know, part of me wants that, but it's like I'm two guys, y'know? I mean, one guy's going 'Shut up! This is great!' But there's this other guy. Actually it's the same guy that wells up every time that Grinch's heart grows three sizes and breaks that measuring device... And he's saying, y'know, 'This is too hard! Get out! Get out!'

utterance.speaker: Aurora
utterance.content: So... which one of the two guys will you listen to?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I don't know, I-I have to listen to both of them, they don't exactly let each other finish...

utterance.speaker: Aurora
utterance.content: Which one?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: ...The second guy.

utterance.speaker: Aurora
utterance.content: Well, call me if you change your mind.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Sorry, the first guy runs the lips.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Look at it this way: you dumped her. Right? I mean, this woman was unbelievably sexy, and beautiful, intelligent, unattainable... Tell me why you did this again?

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey, waitwait, aren't you the guy that plays the butt in the new Al Pacino movie?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Nope.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No? What happened, big guy?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: "Big guy?"

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: It felt like a 'big guy' moment.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I got fired.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Oh!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, they said I acted too much with it. I told everybody about this! Now everybody's gonna go to the theatre, expecting to see me, and...

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, Joey, you know what, no-one is gonna be able to tell.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: My mom will.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Something so sweet and...disturbing about that.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Y'know, I've done nothing but crappy plays for six years. And I finally get my shot, and I blow it!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Maybe this wasn't your shot.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, I mean... I think when it's your shot, y'know, you-you know it's your shot. Did it... feel like your shot..?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hard to tell, I was naked.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No, I don't think this was your shot. I mean, I don't even think you just get one shot. I really believe big things are gonna happen for you, I do! You've gotta just keep thinking about the day that some kid is gonna run up to his friends and go 'I got the part! I got the part! I'm gonna be Joey Tribbiani's ass!'.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah? That's so nice!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I'm sorry, Joey. I'm gonna go to bed, guys.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Night.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Uh, Mon, you-you gonna leave your shoes out here?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Uh-huh!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Really? Just casually strewn about in that reckless haphazard manner?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Doesn't matter, I'll get 'em tomorrow. Or not. Whenever.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: She is a kook.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: If it bothers you that much, just go out and get the shoes. No. Don't do this. This is stupid! I don't have to prove anything, I'm gonna go get them...But then everyone will know. Unless I get them, and then wake up really early and put them back! ...I need help!
